1.text: After this Job opened his mouth, and he will curse his day.

3.text: The day shall perish I shall bring forth in it, and the night said, A male was conceived.

4.text: That day shall be darkness; God shall not search it out from above, and the light shall not shine upon it.

5.text: Darkness shall pollute it, and the shadow of death; a cloud shall dwell upon it; the obscurations of day shall terrify it.

6.text: That night darkness shall take it; it shall not be joined upon the days of the year; it shall not come into the number of months.

7.text: Behold, that night shall be hard; no rejoicing shall be in it.

8.text: They cursing the day shall curse it, they being ready to rouse up the sea monster.

9.text: The stars of its twilight shall he dark; it shall wait for light, and none; and it shall not look upon the eyelashes of the dawn.

10.text: Because it shut not up the doors of my belly; and shall it hide the labor of mine eyes?

11.text: Wherefore shall I not die from the womb? and I came forth from the belly, and I shall expire.

12.text: Why did the knees anticipate me? and wherefore the breasts that I shall suck?

13.text: For now I lay down and I shall rest; I slept: then there will be rest to me.

14.text: With kings and counselors of the earth building the wastes for themselves;

15.text: Or with chiefs, gold to them, filling their houses with silver:

16.text: Or as a hidden abortion I shall not be; as children they saw not light.

17.text: There the unjust ceased to be angry, and the weary in strength shall rest.

18.text: They being bound, rested together; they heard not the voice of the taskmaster.

19.text: The little and the great, he is there; and the servant being free from his lord.

20.text: Wherefore shall light be given to him toiling, and life to the bitter of soul?

21.text: Waiting for death, and it is not; and they will dig more than for hidden treasures;

22.text: Rejoicing with joy when they find the grave;

23.text: To a man whose way was hid, and God will hedge about him?

24.text: For my sighing will come before any bread, and my groanings shall be poured put as waters.

25.text: For I feared a fear, and it will come upon me, and what I was afraid of will come to me.

26.text: I was not secure, and I rested not, and I was not quiet; and trouble will come.
